Body:
Just met with this customer, this case was submitted with the product name being designated as Netwrix Auditor, not Netwrix Enterprise Auditor. The responses to my opening questions did not allude to the product in question being anything but Netwirx Auditor.

 

The customer was frustrated upon getting on Zoom before I told her I was ill equipped to assist her. She asked for a meeting "ASAP" so for whoever gets this case, please do feel free to connect with me if you'd like to see a copy of the Zoom recording as the customer did spend some time articulating to me specifically what issues they're experiencing.

 

As a result of this being an invalid product for yours truly, I am reassigning to TL queue.

What We've Learned Updated: Identified that the FSAC system scans are erroring out on a host "Unable to start scan". We have verified that the agent is collecting activity by testing a file creation and deletion. We also verified that the events are successfully being sent to a SIEM as well.

Next Steps Updated: Allow the current File System Jobs to full complete then run a repair on the affected host. Once the repair has been completed we will run the FSAC system Scan and Bulk Import again.

What We've Learned Updated: Identified that the FSAC system scans are erroring out on a host "Unable to start scan". We have verified that the agent is collecting activity by testing a file creation and deletion. We also verified that the events are successfully being sent to a SIEM as well.
-------------------------------------------------------

11/4/2024 Update

Today we:

Performed an upgrade on the AIC to the latest available version (11.6.0.25) by performing the process mentioned in the documentation below:

Upgrade Procedure

Once the upgrade process was successfully completed we were able to view recent file system activity in the AIC on the desired hosts.

Next Steps Updated: Allow the current File System Jobs to full complete then run a repair on the affected host. Once the repair has been completed we will run the FSAC system Scan and Bulk Import again.
----------------------------------------------------------

11/4/2024


Our next steps are:

You will:

Allow the File System 0.Collections job group to run through the scheduled tasks and verify that the information is displayed in the AIC if there are any new or updated file system activity or permission changes.

I will:

Continue to keep this ticket in a postponed reply status and I will reach out tomorrow for a status update on the AIC and FSAC system scan jobs.
